qas.question: What type of radiation does not contribute mass?
What is another name for electromagnetic radiation?
What is another name for isolated kinetic energy of massive particles?

context: The reason for this is that in this definition, <b0_0>electromagnetic<b0_0/> radiation (such as light) as well as the energy of electromagnetic fields contributes to the mass of systems, and therefore appears to add matter to them. For example, light radiation (or <b1_0>thermal radiation<b1_0/>) trapped inside a box would contribute to the mass of the box, as would any kind of energy inside the box, including the kinetic energy of particles held by the box. Nevertheless, isolated individual particles of light (<b2_0>photons<b2_0/>) and the isolated kinetic energy of massive particles, are normally not considered to be matter.[citation needed]
